hedline.hl1: SAVOS IN DEAL WITH KOREAN COMPANY

abstract.p: South Korea's leading wireless communications carrier, SK Telecom, agrees to acquire technology of its network from Savos, New York wireless services provider; SK Telecom will hold trial run among Seoul customers first to introduce Savos wireless audio portal technology, which allows users access to streaming audio content from Internet on mobile phones (S)

block.p: South Korea's leading wireless communications carrier, SK Telecom, has agreed to acquire technology for its network from Savos, a New York wireless services provider, the companies are expected to announce today. SK Telecom will hold a trial run among Seoul customers first to introduce the Savos wireless audio portal technology, which allows users access to streaming audio content from the Internet on mobile phones. The contract is one of the first examples of a transaction between a large foreign wireless carrier and one of Silicon Alley's fledgling wireless applications companies. ''We plan to use this deal as a platform to expand in other parts of Asia,'' Nathaniel Brochin, the president of Savos, said in an interview.

TECHNOLOGY BRIEFING: DEALS Correction: October 9, 2000, Monday A report in the Technology Briefing column of Business Day on Thursday about a plan for Savos, a New York wireless services provider, to sell audio technology for use in South Korea misstated the name of the buyer. It is SK C&C, not SK Telecom.
